trans-unit.source: Requests that <token>firstref_zumo</token> initiate authentication using a specific identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests that <token>firstref_zumo</token> initiate authentication using a specific identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The returned token is used to make subsequent authenticated requests to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The returned token is used to make subsequent authenticated requests to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When using service-directed login, <token>nextref_zumo</token> initiates an OAuth flow that enables your client to login to <token>nextref_zumo</token> by using the requested identity provider.
trans-unit.target: When using service-directed login, <token>nextref_zumo</token> initiates an OAuth flow that enables your client to login to <token>nextref_zumo</token> by using the requested identity provider.

trans-unit.source: If you have already obtained a token from an identity provider, you can instead use the <link xlink:href="700b4fcc-9b8f-42a1-b7eb-9f4420d2d31e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Client-directed login operation</link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have already obtained a token from an identity provider, you can instead use the <link xlink:href="700b4fcc-9b8f-42a1-b7eb-9f4420d2d31e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Client-directed login operation</link>.

trans-unit.source: The request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;service_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with your mobile service name and <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;provider%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Replace <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;service_name%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with your mobile service name and <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;provider%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> with the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The identity provider used for authentication can be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: The identity provider used for authentication can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Requests a login by using Facebook as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests a login by using Facebook as the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Requests a login by using Google as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests a login by using Google as the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Requests a login by using Live Connect as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests a login by using Live Connect as the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Requests a login by using Twitter as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests a login by using Twitter as the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Requests a login by using Azure Active Directory as the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Requests a login by using Azure Active Directory as the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: You must first configure the identity provider used for authentication with your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You must first configure the identity provider used for authentication with your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This request starts an OAuth flow initiated by <token>nextref_zumo</token>.
trans-unit.target: This request starts an OAuth flow initiated by <token>nextref_zumo</token>.

trans-unit.source: The request may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The request may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: The exact response depends on the state in the OAuth flow.
trans-unit.target: The exact response depends on the state in the OAuth flow.

trans-unit.source: An operation ultimately returns one of the following status codes:
trans-unit.target: An operation ultimately returns one of the following status codes:

trans-unit.source: When login has completed successfully, you are returned to a URL that contains the authentication token as a <newTerm>JSON web token</newTerm> (JWT), with the following format:
trans-unit.target: When login has completed successfully, you are returned to a URL that contains the authentication token as a <newTerm>JSON web token</newTerm> (JWT), with the following format:

trans-unit.source: This status code is returned when an authentication failure occurs.
trans-unit.target: This status code is returned when an authentication failure occurs.

trans-unit.source: This can occur when the identity provider has not been registered with <token>nextref_zumo</token>.
trans-unit.target: This can occur when the identity provider has not been registered with <token>nextref_zumo</token>.

trans-unit.source: Check the error message in the response body for details.
trans-unit.target: Check the error message in the response body for details.

trans-unit.source: During the OAuth process, the OAuth state can be determined from the <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;oauth_state%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> value in the URL, which has the following format:
trans-unit.target: During the OAuth process, the OAuth state can be determined from the <parameterReference>%%amp;lt;oauth_state%%amp;gt;</parameterReference> value in the URL, which has the following format:

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the identity provider to which the login request was redirected.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the identity provider to which the login request was redirected.

trans-unit.source: This page is displayed to allow users to login by using the specific provider.
trans-unit.target: This page is displayed to allow users to login by using the specific provider.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>wams_state</parameterReference> attribute contains the state value that is used in subsequent requests to identify the OAuth session.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>wams_state</parameterReference> attribute contains the state value that is used in subsequent requests to identify the OAuth session.

trans-unit.source: Indicates which version of the runtime executed the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates which version of the runtime executed the request.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) When the OAuth process is complete, a JSON object might be returned that contains fields for the response status (<parameterReference>code</parameterReference>) and the response message (<parameterReference>error</parameterReference>), as follows:
trans-unit.target: (Optional) When the OAuth process is complete, a JSON object might be returned that contains fields for the response status (<parameterReference>code</parameterReference>) and the response message (<parameterReference>error</parameterReference>), as follows:
